title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: On the desert planet Arrakis, young Paul Atreides is thrust into a struggle for control of the most valuable substance in the universe: the spice melange.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A washed-up computer hacker is hired for one last job: to hack the most powerful artificial intelligence in orbit above Earth.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A lone human envoy is sent to the ice-bound planet Gethen to persuade its nations to join an interplanetary civilization.

title: The Big Sleep
author: Raymond Chandler
description: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a wealthy general to resolve a blackmail scheme, but the case spirals into murder and deception.

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
description: In a medieval Italian monastery, a Franciscan friar investigates a series of murders connected to a forbidden book in the labyrinthine library.

title: In the Woods
author: Tana French
description: A Dublin detective investigates the murder of a child found at an archaeological dig, a case that echoes the unsolved disappearance of his own childhood friends.

title: The Guns of August
author: Barbara W. Tuchman
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning account of the first month of World War I, tracing the political miscalculations and military blunders that shaped the conflict.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative of human history from the Stone Age to the present, exploring how biology and culture shaped the species that came to dominate Earth.

title: SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome
author: Mary Beard
description: A thousand-year history of Rome from its founding myth through the granting of citizenship to all free inhabitants of the empire.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The spirited Elizabeth Bennet navigates class, family, and her own misjudgments as she contends with the proud and enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: An elderly man reads from a notebook to a woman suffering from dementia, telling the story of two young lovers separated by war and class.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A former World War II combat nurse is swept back in time to 1743 Scotland, where she encounters a gallant young warrior and is torn between two lives.

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
author: Martin Kleppmann
description: A guide to the principles and practicalities behind reliable, scalable, and maintainable data systems, from replication to stream processing.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: David Thomas and Andrew Hunt
description: A collection of tips and practices for software developers, covering topics from career development to architectural design and pragmatic coding.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship that teaches how to write code that is easy to read, understand, and maintain.

title: Elasticsearch: The Definitive Guide
author: Clinton Gormley and Zachary Tong
description: A comprehensive introduction to Elasticsearch covering distributed search, analytics, and the practicalities of running it in production.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: Seconds before Earth is demolished for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is swept off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect on a wild journey through space.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: On the morning of his fifth wedding anniversary, Nick Dunne reports his wife Amy missing. Under pressure from police and media, his portrait of a blissful union begins to crumble.

title: The Silk Roads
author: Peter Frankopan
description: A reorientation of world history around the ancient trade routes of Central Asia, showing how the East drove global civilisation for millennia.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: Two young people in a small Irish town navigate the complexities of their relationship from secondary school through university, shaped by class and insecurity.
